Interesting Bits 2

Where are a couple of really interesting bits I have collected in the last couple of weeks.

  • Prose.io is a web-based interface for managing text-based content in your GitHub repositories
  • WebZap is a Photoshop plugin that allows you to prototype ideas. It has a set of components that you can easily use to mock up an idea in just a few minutes
  • NetTuts - Perfect Workflow in Sublime Text a free course from Jeffrey Way that teaches you everything that you need to know about this powerful tool
  • A successful Git branching model this one is an oldie but it makes a lot of sense, if you use Git you should definitely give this work flow a try
  • HTML5 Polyfills because sometimes graceful degradation is not an option
  • Scaling your JavaScript Applications Addy Osmani presents a set of design guidelines that you can use today to bulletproof your JavaScript applications for tomorrow
  • Require.js 2.0 Delayed Module Evaluation and Google Maps a really interesting article about version 2.0 of Require.js

I’m telling you all this Internet thing is going to be big.

04 Nov 2012
